issue.title: [C++] Then(const Result<T>&) should run on failure or success
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-12009](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12009). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Adding two callbacks can lead to dense difficult to read code.  If the caller asks for a result then it should be easy to let the callback handle both the failure and the success case.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12009?focusedCommentId=17386430) by Weston Pace (westonpace):*
At this point I think the current mechanism is working fine and this is not needed.
